explanation: The agent's conclusion is not correct. The three lines “(void) cls;”, “(void) connection;” and “(void) toe;” are the common idiom to mark parameters as intentionally unused and to suppress compiler warnings. MISRA Rule 2.2 forbids dead code in the sense of executed operations whose removal would change program behaviour; the cast-to-void expressions have no effect on program behaviour (they only affect diagnostics), and they are an explicit documentation/suppression mechanism rather than accidental leftover code. In MISRA practice this idiom is used to show the unused-parameter intent and is not treated as a Rule 2.2 violation. Therefore the reported violation is incorrect.
